attributes.action: Advise news publishers of accessible, but discriminatory content to cease this.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/news/calls-to-end-transgender-experiment-on-children-k792rfj7d (7th April, 2019: The Sunday Times)

Articles such as this forming the front page of freely accessible newspapers, creating social division, stigmatisation and discrimination from newspaper consumers towards protected minority groups.
attributes.background: This campaign serves to debate the role of businesses (coffee shops and privatised transport agencies) publishing harmful and discriminatory content that is detrimental to minority groups (based upon ethnic, sexual or gender-affiliated propaganda, misconception and inferiority-inferentialism).

rejection.details:
Complaints about the press are the responsibility of the Independent Press Standards Organisation (IPSO), not  the Government or Parliament. 

You can find out how to make a complaint to IPSO here:

https://www.ipso.co.uk/IPSO/makeacomplaint.html
